entries.question: According to Paul Gilbert, what aspect of the cross-examination process makes it uniquely challenging for witnesses?

entries.rationale: Paul Gilbert states that the primary difficulty of cross-examination is 'the use of what I call closed questions. And, you know, this isn't the way we normally ask each other questions.' This directly corresponds to option (C).
